solution_line_template: He reads {morning_reading_per_day_weekday} minutes in the morning {weekday_reading_days} days a week for a total of {morning_reading_per_day_weekday}*{weekday_reading_days} = <<{morning_reading_per_day_weekday}*{weekday_reading_days}={morning_weekday_total_minutes}>>{morning_weekday_total_minutes} minutes

He doubles his reading time on the weekends so {morning_reading_per_day_weekday}*{weekend_reading_multiplier} = <<{morning_reading_per_day_weekday}*{weekend_reading_multiplier}={morning_reading_per_day_weekend}>>{morning_reading_per_day_weekend} minutes per day

He reads {morning_reading_per_day_weekend} minutes on Saturday and Sunday in the mornings for a total of {morning_reading_per_day_weekend}+{morning_reading_per_day_weekend} = <<{morning_reading_per_day_weekend}+{morning_reading_per_day_weekend}={morning_weekend_total_minutes}>>{morning_weekend_total_minutes} minutes

He reads {evening_reading_per_day_weekday_hours} hour in the evenings {weekday_reading_days} days a week for a total of {evening_reading_per_day_weekday_hours}*{weekday_reading_days} = <<{evening_reading_per_day_weekday_hours}*{weekday_reading_days}={evening_weekday_total_hours}>>{evening_weekday_total_hours} hours

He doubles his reading time on the weekends so {evening_reading_per_day_weekday_hours}*{weekend_reading_multiplier} = <<{evening_reading_per_day_weekday_hours}*{weekend_reading_multiplier}={evening_reading_per_day_weekend_hours}>>{evening_reading_per_day_weekend_hours} hours per day

He reads {evening_reading_per_day_weekend_hours} hours on Saturday and Sunday in the evenings for a total of {evening_reading_per_day_weekend_hours}+{evening_reading_per_day_weekend_hours} = <<{evening_reading_per_day_weekend_hours}+{evening_reading_per_day_weekend_hours}={evening_weekend_total_hours}>>{evening_weekend_total_hours} hours

He read {evening_weekday_total_hours}+{evening_weekend_total_hours} = {total_evening_reading_hours} hours which, when converted to minutes is {total_evening_reading_hours}*{minutes_per_hour} = {total_evening_reading_minutes} minutes

He reads {morning_weekday_total_minutes} minutes in the morning and {morning_weekend_total_minutes} minutes in the evenings and {total_evening_reading_minutes} over the weekend for a total of {morning_weekday_total_minutes}+{morning_weekend_total_minutes}+{total_evening_reading_minutes} = {total_reading_minutes_per_week} minutes in 1 week
